p: Mast cells play important roles in allergic inflammation [ 52]. The essential oil from Zanthoxylum coreanum Nakai (ZCO) has been shown to effectively inhibit mast cell degranulation and reduce the level of IL-4, a key inflammatory factor in allergy symptoms [ 53]. Thirty-seven active ingredients identified from ZCO, mainly ß-ocimene and (-)- α-pinene, can alleviate allergic inflammation by suppressing the MAPK and NF- κB signalling pathways. ZCO has good transdermal absorbability [ 54] and will likely be used to treat allergic inflammation in the future.
